title: (04100) Níjar - 1 Plaza Mercado
description: 3 fountains on the main square next to info center. Perfect to fill up some bottles.

title: (04100) Níjar - 6A Calle Escuela Hogar
description: Small car park, near the center. Not suitable for larger vans or motorhomes.

title: (04100) Níjar - 3 Camino Campo
description: No service but ideal for visiting the city

title: (04100) Níjar - 4 Calle Bacares
description: A place of land, although it is inclined at the bottom, it is quite flat, it passes the avenue right next to it but at night it is very quiet, without services but with space for any type of vehicle.

title: (04100) - 3M Diseminado el Hualix
description: Beautiful place on the side of the road reaching Sorbas! Incredible views...

title: (04119) Níjar - 12M Diseminado Risco Muerto
description: Dodge on curve... 10 min via tarmac road from Nijar. Quiet place. Slightly uneven. Space for a maximum of 2 vans... Access is a bit narrow but doable if you're not traveling in a spaceship;)

title: (04100) Níjar -
description: Parking for about 3 vans, steep, no shade, dirt floor. Starting point to visit the Hoyazo crater on foot.

title: (04100) Tristanes - Unnamed Road
description: Several parking spots in nature close to the abandoned dam Isabel II. This dam was inaugurated in 1850, but closed 11 years later as sludge was accumulating in the water reservoir. From the parking spots you can easily access the dam by a short hike track. It is also possible to park closer to the dam, but watch out in rainy weather because of the above mentioned sludge/mud. There’s patchy 3G/4G reception available. Easiest access to the place is from AL-3107, you will see a sign indicating the dam at the crossing. The access road might not be suitable for larger vehicles but we managed easily with our L2H2 van.

title: (04211) Rambla Honda -
description: Beautiful platform at the pass, found "old fashioned" on the map. Magnificent view, absolute calm. Cool at 600 m and wheelbarrows, perfect for one night. No shade.

title: (04100) Tristanes -
description: Do not make a detour to come here, on the other hand if you are looking for a quiet bivouac in the area (which is not easy) you will not be disappointed. The road to get there is ugly (lots and lots of garbage and greenhouses as far as the eye can see) but once you get there you "forget" everything you just saw. The place is quiet, no noise, not overlooked and it's still clean. We came by 4x4 but I think a van can also come, camping because it seems complicated to me.

title: (04100) Campohermoso - 4 Calle Gerona
description: Water fountain to fill the jerry cans just opposite a car park to park the vehicle.

title: (04100) Campohermoso - 12 Avenida Príncipe de Asturias
description: Laundrette. 4 wash machines and 3 dryers.  Need to supply your own washing powder. Care machines only take only coins and the change machine which takes notes only was not working when we visited. Easy parking opposite.

title: (04100) Campohermoso - 487 Autovia E15 salida
description:
Black water and cassete are free service.
Water refill. You need to pay at service station and get the key.

title: (04100) Campohermoso - 13 Carretera de las Negras
description: The AUTOLAUNDRY laundry, is located on a main road direction the black, rodalquilar, etc. Easy parking, cash payment (has a machine to change bills to coins) and immediate restitution in case of any problem.

title: (04210) Lucainena de las Torres - Calle Unamuno
title_short: (04210) Lucainena de las Torres - Calle Unamuno
description: Parking of the old mines. something inclined. about 5 minutes walk to town.

title: (04211) Turrillas -
description:
Nice view along a small road.
Attention, it does not cross everywhere, but tell yourself that they have mounted the blades of the wind turbines, so do not panic!
Many hiking possibilities
Several other possible places: The natural park is 1km to the south and anyway there they could not have installed wind turbines.. (Be careful to park well if there were to be interventions on the nacelles)

title: (04210) Lucainena de las Torres - 18 Calle Bilbao
title_short: (04210) Lucainena de las Torres - 18 Calle Bilbao
description: The parking lot has now been expanded. possibility to park on asphalt or behind it on paved area. Also possible for larger motorhomes, although the access road from Nijar is very narrow for many km. Good starting point for Via Verde (walking and cycling)

title: (04211) Turrillas - Camino del Collado de Marín
title_short: (04211) Turrillas - Camino del Collado de Marín
description: Nice parking spot on flat ground with fantastic view through camper windows. From here you can reach Pico Colativi. The highest point of Sierra Alhamilla mountain range. And also through camper window you can see mountain goats walking around.

title: (04113) Atochares - 44 Calle Mirasierra
description: Large paved car park on a slight slope, easy to access, on the edge of the village.

title: (04114) Níjar - N-341
description: Shell gas station. There is an air and water machine. Next to it there is a grate to release gray water and, if not, there are also two self-cleaning stations with grilles. And gasoline well priced.

title: (04211) Los Retacos -
description: Small, quiet, fairly level, earthy site below the slope in front of a water reservoir. No prohibition signs whatsoever, no service, no shade whatsoever, good mobile communications, for a maximum of 3 to 4 vehicles, easy access, very friendly local passers-by. Have respect, reciprocate the warmth of the few passers-by and leave everything clean.

title: (04211) Los Retacos -
description: We were coming from a nice 4x4 trip and spotted this place just near a normal road. We stopped here for lunch and it seems to be a very quiet spot accessible by a short gravel road. We didn‘t sleep here but it seems nice and quite.

title: (04114) Níjar - N-341
description: Small corner for vans, the access road is quite bumpy. Amidst agriculture and nature, some noises of tractors in the distance. No shade, no services.

title: (04200) Tabernas - unnamed Road
description: Nice flat lawn on the edge of the track. We just stopped there for a picnic but it must be very pleasant to sleep there.

title: (04116) Albaricoques - C. los Martinez
description: Public car park next to the camper place. Just. We stayed there with 3 other motorhomes as we arrived late at the motorhome and found it closed.

title: (04116) Albaricoques - c/Cortijo Jurado, s/n
description: Camper Park Olivares. Nice Camper Area in a quite environment, and near the most beautiful beaches of Cabo de Gata. All services available. Grey and Black water, fresh water, WC, showers, washing machine, Wifi, car rental, etc...

title: (04270) Sorbas - 22 Calle Jaen
description: At the end of a cul-de-sac there is a playground with swings, slides, a nest swing and a small soccer field. Nice view since it is built under, about 6 parking spaces available

title: (04270) Sorbas - 3 N-340a
description: Rest area of the road, under the town of Sorbas, no service. Gratuitous. Quiet place Illuminated road / stairs to access the old town of Sorbas.

title: (04270) Sorbas - 1Z Calle Alcala
description: Near the road but possibility to park near the city center. No water.

name: Little Texas
title: (04200) Little Texas
description:
Family run motorhome Park.

Western Themed Restaurant and Restaurant Bar - Under Construction 

Authentic Wooden Western Themed Lodges with amazing mountain views - Coming Soon

Solar Heated Swimming Pool - 365 Days A Year (Now Open)

Solar Heated Hot Water and Showers - Now Installed

Solar PV now powering the entire site and all Electrical Hookups 

New Reception and Shop - Now Open

Little Texas Tabernas is a small family owned Motorhome Park and Camping Site located in a rural environment with stunning mountain scenery.  Our site has all the facilities you may need for your stay including a Shop, Bar, Electricity (6 Amp), WiFi, Toilets, Hot Showers, Filtered Drinking Water, Grey/Black Water Disposal, Washing Machine, Heated Swimming Pool and Freshly Baked Bread and Pastries available for breakfast every morning. Our site is the perfect place for walkers, cyclists and bikers with numerous mountain roads and trails to keep you occupied for days or a beautiful pool area should you feel the need to relax and enjoy the hot Spanish sun. Please call or email to make a reservation. Further information is available on our web site. We look forward to seeing you soon here at LittleTexas!!

title: (04270) Sorbas - 8 Calle Gerona
description: Quiet parking in the sports area, ideal to know the place

title: (04270) Sorbas - 71 Calle Campanario
description: Next to football field, stayed 2 nights at the weekend, very quiet. Benches and waste bins on the square in front of it. There is a tap at small building near palm tree, but local youth said it is not drinking water, only for washing.

title: (04131) Mazarrulleque -
description: Spot in nature, accessible by a gravel path. attention path not referenced by Google but exists! accessible to any type of vehicle, even large ones. pay attention to the path on the left coming from Almeria, a small paved road with a small steep climb then you arrive on the gravel path, several spots are available according to your desires. if you continue to the end you come across a round construction. 360°C sea, mountain and Almeria view (a few agricultural greenhouses) quiet night, no visitors! no services

title: (04160) Almería - Avenida de la Innovación, 15
description: Repsol gas station water emptying and filling service you can take a shower. When refueling, you are allowed to fill water at the air+water service post.

title: (04131) Mazarrulleque -
description: A place somewhere in nowhere. Overlooking the sea. Super calm.

name: Finca De La Horca
title: (04270) Finca De La Horca
description:
⚠️ IMPORTANT INFORMATION! PLEASE CALL AHEAD AND INQUIRE ABOUT AVAILABILITY 

"A unique place with a feeling of freedom in the sun-drenched Andalusia!"

Our farm "Finca de la Horca" is located on the edge of the only European desert with famous filming locations from "Indiana Jones", "Once Upon a Time in the West" or "The Shoe of Manitou". We offer natural camping and tent sites as well as vacation homes year-round, providing a welcoming retreat for travelers.

A fascinating place with a panoramic view of nature and the idyllic village of Sorbas. We also produce our own organic olive oil. Experience the taste of Andalusia.

- Shower and toilet available.
- Upon request, the owner can provide an electrical connection for a small additional fee. 6 amps.
- Wastewater and fresh water available. Not included in the price for visitors staying 1 day.

We look forward to seeing you!

title: () Sorbas - A-1102

title: (04115) Rodalquilar -
description: Ideal place in the middle of nature, in the middle of old gold mines. The land has a slight slope. Some hikers, mountain bikers... spend the day but at night there is no noise apart from those of nature. Access is by rocky roads but it can be passed with any vehicle. We were supposed to stay only one night, but in the end we spent 5 days there.

name: bp | Almería
title: (04151) bp | Almería
description: Service station at the bp gas station with many large parking spaces, 20 or more. With fresh water and disposal.

name: Cabo de Gata Camper Park
title: (04117) Cabo de Gata Camper Park
description:
Cabo de Gata Camper Park, is located in one of the main entrances of the natural park and within walking distance of the most beautiful and interesting places. Within a radius of 20 minutes you can reach practically every corner of the park... Rodalquilar, Las Negras, Cala San Pedro, Isleta del Moro, Escullos, San José, Monsul, Genoveses, Cabo de Gata... and so on. to be able to enjoy its wonderful geological, landscape, gastronomic, tourist wealth. The facilities have a bar-restaurant with a daily menu and you can order bread and pasta for the next day. Wooded and landscaped area with an enclosure with farm birds for the enjoyment of the little ones and a circular bike circuit so that the little ones can walk safely. PIPICAN area for our pets. At reception we will inform you of the places that you can visit, listening to your preferences. The washer and dryer, as well as sinks for washing clothes and dishes, complete the offer. Access for the disabled, video surveillance, toilets, showers, laundry, Wi-Fi... Attention 24 hours a day throughout the year. In short, much more than an overnight area, which is why its visitors usually consider it a mini campsite. Detailed price of services: check our website

Price of services
electricity €5, dryer and washing machine (€3.5 - €4.00)
----------
Low season parking price
€10 2 adults (loading and unloading, and showers) Additional person €3 - Children 3-11 years €2 - Children 0-2 free - Pets free
------------
High season parking price
€15 2 adults (loading and unloading, and showers) Additional person €5 - Children 3-11 years €3 - Children 0-2 free - Pets free
-------------
Number of car parks
40
------------
Open 24 hours, 365 days

title: (04277) El Salto del Lobo -
description: I have a lovely small house in the country near Cabo de Gata National park, only 3km off the A7/E15. I have land you can park on. It’s 5 mins drive to the nearest bar and swimming pool, 20 mins to  towns and supermarkets. 30 mins to the beaches of either Carbonares or Mojácar. Very peaceful with beautiful views. Tables and chairs available as is a gas  BBQ. I have two lovely dogs, no blue loo chemical please as I have a soak away, €3 to fill up with water. Washing machine 6kg €3, electricity only for light use eg. Lights, charging free. Not suitable for very large vans. Please call or WhatsApp  before arriving, to book

The street on the corner, between a restaurant and an ATM, is an inconspicuous but really great bakery with very, very good bread and croissants! Value for money and willingness to help were unbeatable.

title: (04115) Rodalquilar -

The path is bumpy, especially at the beginning. The "Indiana Jones" tunnel is a 40 minute walk away. The tunnel does not present a great interest, on the other hand the spectacle at the exit is magnificent. Only for lovers of wide open spaces...

title: (04115) Níjar - 9 Calle Apartadero

The first 200m is recorded but if you go slowly there is no problem. It is right at the crossroads to continue climbing to the other place that is a little higher and that is also incredible.

name: Camper Área Cabo de Gata
title: (04151) Camper Área Cabo de Gata
description: Motorhomes, caravans and campers area in the Natural Park of Cabo de Gata. Easy access from the Almería highway to Cabo de Gata (AL-3115 at Km 10) and in a country setting, with a gravel surface. It has all the services and amenities: disabled access, video surveillance, toilets, showers, laundry, leisure room, free Wi-Fi ... Open all year. In addition, the camper has a laundry room with washers and dryers to help you clean your clothes, as well as bathroom facilities and hot showers. Located in the Cabo de Gata Natural Park, with 63 km of coastline that are home to cliffs and sea beds classified among the highest quality on the Spanish Mediterranean coast, and an average of 3,160 hours of sunshine per year. In addition to magnificent beaches, in our town, Cabo de Gata, you can find everything you need to make your vacation truly restful days; diving clubs, bicycle rental points, kayaks, boat trips, banks, gas station, pharmacies. Also very beautiful areas to visit, such as the viewpoint of the beach of the dead or the Cabo de Gata lighthouse next to the Las Sirenas Reef. And of course a great variety of bars and restaurants where you can taste the best tapas and food in the area. Pitches delimited by hedges. Pets are allowed. Located within the Cabo de Gata Natural Park, a Biosphere Reserve with natural beaches and one of the most important wetlands on the peninsula. It also has several bird observatories, since these areas constitute the best observation bases for both summer, (flamingos, storks, egrets and many waders that come from Europe, Africa and other areas of Andalusia and also carracks, bee-eaters, who go to the steppe zone) and winter (lapwing, curlew, bullfinch, etc.). it is equally important as a base for migratory birds (turtledoves, warblers, kings, vultures, etc.) and permanent birds (marshland, owl, kestrel ...). In addition, you can stroll along the multiple beaches of Cabo de Gata-Nijar where you will perceive peace and tranquility. For all those travelers who enjoy freedom of movement, Camper Area Cabo de Gata offers you all the basic services and the best service. An area for motorhomes, caravans and campers located in the Natural Park of Cabo de Gata, where you can enjoy the tranquility, good weather, nature, gastronomy, leisure and all kinds of nautical and sports activities. It will be a destination that you will always remember.

address.street: Ctra. Cabo de Gata AL-3115 Km 10

description: Super spot in the middle of nature. We got there with an Itinéo SB740. We parked quite far on the plot and despite a few passages of cars our presence did not bother, we left in the morning.

title: (04200) Tabernas - Unnamed Road
description: Shortly before the start of the nature reserve, behind the small parking lot at the end of Mini Hollywood, there is a small parking space for 2 RVs. No direct view of Mini Hollywood. We had no problems getting to the site with our 7m mobile home.

title: (04115) Níjar - Unnamed Road
description: With a view of the castle ruins!

title: (04270) Sorbas - Unnamed Road
description: Abandoned town of Marchalico. Very calm. Access road from the Smithy and the A7 in poor condition. Recommended to access from the N340 next to the mine.

title: (04116) - 1 Diseminado Playazo
description: Parking of the beach, super nice very nice no worries, overnight stay forbidden!

title: (04115) Rodalquilar - Unnamed Road
description: Quiet place, the road a little abandoned but going slowly is quite easy, there is room for 3 or 4 vans. Great for hiking, there is a beautiful view of the sea.

title: (04289) La Herreria - AL-6110
description: Roadside parking on the way to Marchalico Vinicas. The ground is roughly even, and it's surrounded by trees, therefore quite out of sight. It is comfortably suitable for 1-2 campers or 3 smaller vans. The road leading up is of very bad quality, full of big holes. Not recommended in rainy weather because the car can easily get stuck.

title: (04116) - 1 Diseminado Playazo
description: To access this spot follow the road that continues above the main car park to the old abandoned building. Stone road but passable. Sea view and lapping waves to rock us. There were two of us on this spot and no one was along to control it. Forbidden at night

title: (04150) Cabo de Gata - 28 Calle la Lecha
title_short: (04150) Cabo de Gata - 28 Calle la Lecha
description: Spectacular place!!! Crystal clear water bars nearby, right where I am you can't spend money but on the street if you can, on the other side of the city there is another parking lot that we did overnight without problems, I recommend it 200% if you want peace of mind, eat luxury, lonely beaches

title: (04115) Rodalquilar - Unnamed Road
description: This Place appears nice but many people are robbed during the night! Do not sleep here!

title: (04150) Cabo de Gata - 116 Costa Miramar
description: The police make rounds and prohibit overnight parking of motorhomes.

title: (04270) Marchalico Viñicas - Unnamed Road
description: Really nice spot at the top of the hill (just a couple of minutes drive from the spot below). 360 degree full view and the Sunset behind the mountains of Sierra Nevada. I've only see 2 hikers here in 2 days (christmas days) so its very private. I've had no wind here (the lower spot was very windy) and it was very hot. 4g internet connection. Much recommended!

title: (04270) Marchalico Viñicas -
description: A larger site between the other two, very good access from the N340a, abandoned town a little further down the road with a very nice circular route to the mine and back to the site

title: (04115) Nijar - AL-4200
description: Parking to see the viewpoint of the amethyst

title: (04150) Cabo de Gata - 10 Carretera Cabo de Gata
title_short: (04150) Cabo de Gata - 10 Carretera Cabo de Gata
description: Open space near all the services of the town of Cabo de Gata, a good place to spend the night even if it is somewhat close to the road with more traffic that the town has. Much better than sleeping surrounded by motorhomes in the La Fabriquilla area that looks like a shanty town for motorhomes ....

title: (04118) Níjar - AL-4200
description: Next to a medieval tower, it overlooks Escolleros beach and the mountains that surround it. Quiet place and easy access. There are no signs of prohibited parking

title: (04200) Tabernas - Unnamed Road
description:
Parking day and night
if you take tickets to visit Fort Bravo you will have to pay 15€ more to have access to the campsite.

name: Camping Los Escullos
title: (04117) Camping Los Escullos
description: Níjar, Unnamed Road. Camping Amusement Escullos and activities. Small parcels. The showers did not work well over half of them.

name: Parking Autocaravanas | Oasys MiniHollywood | Tabernas
title: (04200) Parking Autocaravanas | Oasys MiniHollywood | Tabernas
description: On the doorstep of Mini Hollywood, perfect for site seeing. Parking guarded day and night. Open Saturday, Sunday and public holidays.

title: (04118) Níjar - 35 Calle Cala de la Polacra
title_short: (04118) Níjar - 35 Calle Cala de la Polacra
description: This is actually a very quiet place to spend the night, considering you are not allowed to park overnight in any place overlooking the beach.

title: (04115) Almería - Unnamed Road
description: Difficult access track with steps and big ruts, only for 4x4 with good ground clearance. Little space, since the creation of the spot the "terraces" between the olive trees have been plowed, it no longer goes in a van. Access by walking to a beautiful wild beach.,

title: (04270) Sorbas - Unnamed Road
description: Small earthen parking lot adjoining a very deep plaster quarry. Quiet and clean despite everything. Nice point of view. However, beware the road is very bumpy. Not recommended for long motorhomes.

title: (04118) Níjar - 2 Carretera Noria
description: Parking above the beach, small authentic village, superb setting, calm...

title: (04150) Cabo de Gata - 17 Plaza de la Malvasía
title_short: (04150) Cabo de Gata - 17 Plaza de la Malvasía
description: Large car park by the sea. Water point in front of the car park towards the sea. Beach showers with little water. Parking partially paved, partially sandy. Without shadow. The worst thing about this car park are the motorhomes themselves. Many decide to empty their gray water and pots down a drain. This sewer is not for RV use! The neighbors are fed up with this attitude and are going to ban them from staying overnight. In the area there are several areas where you can change the water for a fee. Please find out about the Spanish regulations for motorhomes and respect them! It is for the good of all.

title: (04118) La Isleta - 3 Calle Terrera de Mágina
title_short: (04118) La Isleta - 3 Calle Terrera de Mágina
description: Parking on a quiet street. Space for about 10 cars (also up to 7m in length) available.

name: Camping Fort Bravo
title: (04200) Camping Fort Bravo
description: Camping Fort Bravo. Approximately 20 plots, there is no shade in the sun. Showers, water at the foot of the property. Purchase of tickets to Fort Bravo is mandatory. With full service and admission.

title: (04200) Tabernas - Carretera Nacional 340
description: Small parking lot in front of the park entrance Mini Oasis Hollywood, no service, off the road, but with beautiful views of the desert and the Fort Bravo Park

title: (04118) Níjar - 2 Calle Cala Chica
description: Earth parking on the cliff of the paya. It is higher than the other, but this car park belongs to the town hall, and the other to the natural park.

title: (04118) La Isleta - 26 Avenida Terrera Magina
description: Earth esplanade, fairly well leveled. Located next to the viewpoint.

title: (04117) El Pozo de los Frailes - 74 Calle las Pocicas
title_short: (04117) El Pozo de los Frailes - 74 Calle las Pocicas
description: There is a tap with water down the stairs at the information point in the Pozo de los Frailes. You have to park outside. One day with plenty of water and the other with less. A funnel is recommended

title: (04200) Tabernas - Unnamed Road
description: Nice quiet place on a hill south of a wide flat valley for 2-3 vehicles next to the slope. No service. Mobile good. Driveway approx. 800 m towards Fort Bravo, then take the track to the right through a narrow valley and then follow the main slope steadily uphill.

title: (04118) La Isleta - 40 Calle Mar Mediterráneo
description: Functional washhouse with 6 taps in the shade

title: (04200) Tabernas - N-340a
description: Small space near the road. Flat place and on compact ground. Ideal for a break away from full parking lots.

title: (04117) El Pozo de los Frailes - 130 Calle Curry
title_short: (04117) El Pozo de los Frailes - 130 Calle Curry
description: Esplanade of land next to the road, it is used as a parking lot for the hostel next door, there is noise from cars passing but we were able to spend the night without problems

title: (04118) Almería - 11 Diseminado los Escullos
description: Place about 50m from the sea. In the area are beautiful sandstone formations to visit and a Castello.

title: (04118) Nijar - 11 Diseminado los Escullos
description: No shade, no services but just a few steps from the beach and the bar. No parking at night. Natural Park.

title: (04200) Tabernas - Unnamed Road
description: Small place near the highway with a beautiful view of the desert. The road should be manageable for all vehicles without rain.

name: Camp y Niño
title: (04250) Camp y Niño
description:
8 km from Almería, 12 km from the beach is the beautiful, green mobile home park with numerous possibilities and activities for children.
In addition to a playground with a climbing wall and a large sandbox with a mud kitchen, there is a playhouse with Montessori toys, books, board games and a play and exercise yurt for children. In our studio, your children can get creative and create beautiful memories.
Our Kettcars are available for the children and a large trampoline invites you to jump.

You can come to us with a mobile home, van, caravan or tent. We have 4 pitches with grass in the front area, which can easily be accessed by large mobile homes and caravans. Vans, vehicles with roof tents and tents can find a nice place with shade in our orange garden.
You can also rent one of our comfortably furnished yurts for up to 7 people and use all the services and activities on the site like the campers.

In Pechina there are many shops, a weekly market and restaurants. Directly opposite is a bar where you can get a good breakfast and a varied 3-course lunch menu on weekdays for little money.
The bus connection to Almeria is good, the natural beaches of Cabo de Gata are only 30 minutes away by car. Other excursions are nearby.

Our prices 2023:

The basic price includes a mobile home parking space for 2 people including all services on the site.

☀️ Summer promotion in July and August for pitches, tent sites and yurts ☀️

10% on all stays of 4 nights or more
20% on all stays of 8 nights or more

Discount on longer stays on request.

We look forward to your inquiries by phone, email or WhatsApp.

title: (04240) Viator - 3 Calle Sierra Cabrera
description: Water connection behind BP petrol station (at the exit of the car wash). We were able to fill up our 45l water tank without any problems, the water pressure was very strong.

title: (04560) Rioja -
description: Oasis Lawrence of Arabia. You cannot spend the night here, it is forbidden in the whole park. Exit on the A-92 service road and take the dirt road under the bridge. A bit noisy due to the proximity to the road. From the same bridge there is a route (on foot) to see the Dragon's Tails and the Hangman's Tree. It's worth the detour.

title: (04149) Agua Amarga - 25 Calle Ensenada
description: It is surrounded by mountains with the sea front. The road to go is of Earth in the last 6 kilometers and some difficult places.

title: (04200) Gádor - A-92
description: Large esplanade behind the gas station with a brutal panorama of the Tabernas desert. The road is close, but there is not much traffic. Staying overnight is not allowed

title: (04149) Agua Amarga -
description: Lovely location, only serious 4/4 , very hard to get to

title: (04200) Tabernas - Unnamed Road
description: Fort Leone: After paying the entrance fee for the city of the film, you can spend a night here in the middle of the desert or in the new camper van area.

title: (04230) Huércal de Almería - 7 Poligono S-I4
description: Parking near highway but without noise. Next to a service station with water.

title: (04149) Agua Amarga - 19 Calle Embarque
description: Parking space beside the main road, easy access to the beach, it has space for around 5 motorhomes. No signs informing that is not permitted to park at any time

title: (04149) Agua Amarga - 19 Calle Embarque
description: Parking for 3/4 motorhomes. It is dirt and uneven. The only option in the area to park without paying. We spent the night with no problems.

title: (04260) Moscolux -
description:
A place in the middle of nowhere. It is next to the road so you can hear the cars at night. For us, it was just 1 night passing through stop. Don't expect to much. maybe if you follow the road further on, it is more quiet and beautiful. we arrived at night so didn't felt like driving the dirt road. 
How to get there: Drive at the N340A (Next to the highway), and go of road at the sign for the ruin. there is a Tunnel that goes under the highway, follow this way and you will get there.

name: AGUA-AMARGA CAMPER PARK
title: (04149) AGUA-AMARGA CAMPER PARK
description: AGUA-AMARGA CAMPER PARK, Area of ​​new opening 200 meters from the beach, with all the services to enjoy CABO DE GATA. large and comfortable plots. enclosed and safe. Service of toilets, showers, laundry, light, loading and unloading. all in the center of the town.

address.street: Cabo de Gata/Agua Amarga Camper Park

title: (04639) Turre - Rambla del Puerto de la Limera
title_short: (04639) Turre - Rambla del Puerto de la Limera
description: Picnic area in the middle of nature. Access by dirt track for 6 km, complicated for AC of more than 6.5 meters. There are barbecues, picnic areas, garbage cans and a water fountain.

address.street: Rambla del Puerto de la Limera

title: (04120) Almería - Calle María Montessori
description: City parking, ideal if you must take a walk to the centro de salud. Vaccinations etc. for baby. Nothing nice, but ok. Drinking water point nearby and trash cans with sorting.

title: (04149) Agua Amarga - Calle Rambla
description: Parking with entry restriction, only normal size camper. no overnight

title: (04118) San José - C. Cala Higuera
description: In-line parking on the street that enters the town of San José with little traffic. Quiet and allows you to walk to the town.

title: (04230) Huércal de Almería - 41 Calle Turquesa
description: Rest area very quiet 2 minutes from the highway and 10 minutes from the beach, no noise.

title: (04149) Agua Amarga - 114 Calle Seis
description: Parking in residential area, quiet and safe place

title: (04149) Carboneras - 1 Calle UA-13
description: You go up a hill and arrive at the place, which is like a rubble dump, sheltered from the road, good for eating and spending the night. at least nobody has told us anything

title: (04118) San José - S/N Calle Cala Higuera
title_short: (04118) San José - S/N Calle Cala Higuera
description: In front of the campsite you can empty chemical toilets for free and fill up with 40L of water for €2.

title: (04118) San José - 5 Calle Ancla
description: Free public parking during the day. Very easy access (not fenced), although inclined. A 10-minute walk through the beautiful town to reach the beach of San José.

name: Camping Albergue Tau
title: (04118) Camping Albergue Tau
description: Camping Albergue Tau. Loading / unloading of water outside the campsite (1 euro = 1 minute of water)

title: (04118) San José -
description: Place in the middle of nature in a small nook facing the sea very quiet very nice the beach not far away a small cove with clear water accessible to all vehicles

title: (04118) San José - 1 Calle Coral
description: This place is public parking near the town hall but you can't stay overnight, very central and 200m from San José beach.

title: (04009) -
description: Close to a large shopping center. Ideal for a break and for shopping. Spectacular view. Children's games. We did not spend the night but I think it is quite possible to sleep there.

title: (04230) Huércal de Almería - 66 N-340a
description: Repsol station with water for services (we don't use it for drinking)

title: (04118) San José -
description: Stunning site on the out skirts of San José. Only accessible by competent 4by4s. No one around, one goat herder before sunset, that’s it!

title: (04149) Agua Amarga - 291M Diseminado Agua Amarga
description: This is an amazing spot. The views are breathtaking and from here you can walk to the ocean. There are some hikers coming by but not much. About 100m before this spot the road is not easy, big camper can’t come here. We are 6m and high clearance but low vans can’t drive over the rocks. If you hike south/ southwest you will find a private beach in about 25 minutes. We had the fastest internet ever here in Spain on this spot! Keep it clean my camper friends.

title: (04118) San José - 6 Calle Ensenada
description: A wide, flat public land area with some shady areas. Quiet at night. During the day it gets crowded being near the beach, at night we have been alone (in mid-July).

title: (04149) Agua Amarga -
description: A tranquil place to spend the night just outside Agua Amarga. A bit windy. Nice view of the pueblo and the sea. Close to some old ruins. A small village is visible, but it’s pretty far. Some runners and hikers show up from time to time.

title: (04410) Benahadux - 2 Diseminado la Viña
description: Picnic area with large picnic areas, swings, barbecues and basra bucket and video container. There is shade. There are sources but they do not work. It can be accessed with large AC although part of the road is untarred.

title: (04118) San José - 17 Calle Ronda
description: Dirt parking without any explicit prohibition parking at the end of this we could sleep peacefully with plenty of room

title: (04410) Benahadux - Unnamed Road
description: Very large space, lots of space, accessible to all, no restrictions sign, quiet place close to almeria

title: (04009) Almería - 26 Calle Cobre
description: 14.11.2022 LPG 0,939/l Diesel 1,869/l. You can refill gas with own adapter.

title: (04150) Almería - AL-3115
description: Along the entire beach line. Parking for motorhomes. Nobody bothered us, only vehicle traffic on the street. Small vehicles only

title: (04118) San José - 30 Calle del Puerto
description: Public toilets area with their respective showers on the beach

title: (04117) El Pozo de los Frailes - 12 Diseminado Meseta Alta
title_short: (04117) El Pozo de los Frailes - 12 Diseminado Meseta Alta
description: Next to the main road of Cabo de Gata but with little influx of cars (we went in winter), pleasant views of the coastline, in the morning you can see the views of the south face of Cabo de Gata illuminated by light sun fire.

title: (04118) - 10 Diseminado Cerro Enmedio
description: Nice place to spend the day, in front of Cala La Higuera. ! no camping! The road is a little hard, but only 4 km. Views of the sea and the mountains. You have a hotel with restaurant on the side. Check the route in satellite view

title: (04120) Almería - 53 Poligono Ue
description: Drinking water tap at the side of the road, good access to fill up

title: (04150) Almería - Al-3115
description: The place is right on the street but from 10 p.m. no more cars drive here, fantastic sunset, beach as far as the eye can see, 150m to the beach shower in town. Very quiet day. The police allowed staying here and sent me here.

title: (04009) Almería - 4R Calle García de Villarroel
description: Good place to park and spend the night. Next to the Torrecardenas hospital. There are no services of any kind, the only one in the surrounding bar. It is about 15 minutes walk to the center of the city of Almeria.

title: (04639) Royo Morera -
description: Small gravel parking lot with room for 2 CCs. Very quiet with superb views of the mountains and the valley.

title: (04118) San José - 472 Calle Ronda de San José
title_short: (04118) San José - 472 Calle Ronda de San José
description: Street with few parking spaces, near the town to visit San José and go down to the beach.

title: (04289) Almocaizar -
description: On both sides of the road. We stopped for lunch break. Without facilities.

title: (04120) Almería - AL-3202
description: Nice parking facing the sea, quiet

title: (04118) San José - 548 Calle la Calilla
description: Quiet place to spend the day not far from the center of San José. Spectacular sunrise!

title: (04150) La Almadraba de Monteleva - 0 Calle Camino Viejo Del Faro
title_short: (04150) La Almadraba de Monteleva - 0 Calle Camino Viejo Del Faro
description: Water source

title: (04007) Almería - 418 Carretera de Níjar
description: In an industrial area but we had no choice, because the battery and alternator had failed. We still had a good night in front of the garage, large parking lot, for one night it can help out! Nearby shops: Aldo, Lidl and Grand Mercado. Service station at 100m.

title: (04149) La Mesa Roldán - Unnamed Road
description:
Site accessible only for 4*4 vehicles.
Nature corner above the cliff access to the sports beach.

title: (04006) Almería - Calle Acebo
description: Large car park with plenty of lunch spots

title: (04118) San José - 23 Calle Aljibe
description:
Parking on the road. nothing special except for the views.
It's an open parking on the road so it can be busy.

title: (04118) San José - Calle la Morra
description: Wonderful view. Delicious restaurant nearby within walking distance of playa de los Genoveses

title: (04009) Almería - 87 Calle Antonio Cano
description: Car park at the shopping center, Alcampo petrol station right next door, Almeria's best price for fuel. Crowded during Christmas time.

title: (04149) La Mesa Roldán -
description: Bumpy road but doable even with two wheel drive. Not recommended with recent rain or precipitation. Along the road there are several flat areas where you can park and the possibility of being quiet in nature with access to various very isolated coves/beaches nearby

title: (04118) Níjar - 627T Calle la Morra
description: Car parking to access the Genoese beach on foot. It is an asphalt road and although the Civil Guard is a few 300 meters away they did not say anything.

title: (04150) Almería - 57-69 Calle Carretera Antigua del Faro
title_short: (04150) Almería - 57-69 Calle Carretera Antigua del Faro
description: Asphalt parking lot with sea view without services. Do not park on the raised area between the poles, the police see this as a sports field. Likewise, the police do not want to see wedges under the wheels, as this is not allowed on the road, only on campsites.

name: ARM Autoservicio Lavadero
title: (04140) ARM Autoservicio Lavadero
description:
There is no car wash here, but a high-pressure cleaner for tall vehicles. Unfortunately no stage, but the hose is suspended very high and reaches well over high vehicles.
Cleaner (super hot!), rinse (cold) and seal (cold).
Perfect; to rid the vehicle of salt water when standing by the sea.
There is also drinking water.

title: (04120) El Bobar - Cam. Jaúl Bajo
description: Large paved car park, 20 meters from the road, but very quiet at night. It is the last of the three car parks going up from the beach, it is far enough from the kennel.

name: Genoveses' Beach Car Park
title: (04118) Genoveses' Beach Car Park
description: Parking at the beach, banned at night. Access by good track. Other parking at 3 km less good, but more beautiful cala. In any case we are 200 m from the sea. Attention all the park is prohibited at night. For the 4-day weekend of 5, 6, 7, 8 December in front of the influx of Spaniards the park guards came to hunt us, we went to La Isleta, the same, then it was the Guarda Civil. We ended up in an abandoned urbanization. They are nice and do not put fine.
